meanings.definition: A widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time.
meanings.sent1: The epidemics of flu affected many people in the town.
meanings.sent2: Historically, epidemics like the Black Death caused great devastation.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show joked about a silly epidemic of sneezing in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter spread through the room like an epidemic.
meanings.sent5: The image of the spreading flu epidemic was alarming.

meanings.definition: A sudden, widespread occurrence of a particular undesirable phenomenon.
meanings.sent1: The epidemics of gossip in the office led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: During the financial crisis, epidemics of job losses were common.
meanings.sent3: The epidemic of spilled coffee cups in the break room was comical.
meanings.sent4: The epidemic of fake news spread like wildfire on social media.
meanings.sent5: The epidemic of littering in the park was a visible problem.
